TopicTitle: [STOCK] [Super-Detailed] WWII Era Vehicles (Latest: Supermarine Spitfire) [With BD Armory Variants]

Articles.Content:
(Pictured: Messerschmitt BF 109)

Hi-de-ho everyone, Rix Killian here, pleased to unveil the latest in Killian Dynamic Systems (KDS) replica technology! Today we'll be stepping back in time, to the days of Swing Jazz, early radar, and the first jet aircraft. That's right folks, we're heading back to the early 1940's, when WWII raged throughout the world!

All aircraft are built to within 5% of their original dimensions, with heavy focus on flight behaviors such as maneuverability and top speed.

Land vehicles are built to approximately 130% scale in order to scale properly with KSP wheels. All Land vehicles have "functional" engines that must be turned on - see description.

Every craft is flyable without SAS (I never use it for any of these)

That said, let's move on the the showcase!

 

Latest: LCVP - Higgins Boat (Under "Ships" category)

 

Aircraft

Spoiler

Fighters:

Vought F4U Corsair

The Vought F4U Corsair was an American carrier based naval fighter. It includes a tailhook arrestor system to allow carrier use. This plane has a small amount of static instability to generate massive maneuverability, so it does take some practice to get used to its flight behavior.

Parts: 132

Mass: 7.8 tons

Cost: 106052

Top Speed: 130 m/s

BDArmory version: Two wing mounted machine guns, two rocket pods

Stock Version Download

BDArmory Version Download

 

Curtiss P-36 Hawk

The Curtiss P-36 was an American-built fighter that was on the forefront of a new wave of combat aircraft - with a mostly metal monoplane design and a powerful radial engine. This replica is my favorite of those I’ve built, both in terms of flight characteristics and the clean lines.

Parts: 167

Mass: 8.0 tons

Cost: 75770

Top Speed: 130 m/s

BDArmory version: Two wing mounted cannons

Stock Version Download

BDArmory Version Download

 

Supermarine Spitfire Mk VI

While not the most numerous RAF fighter plane in the war, the Spitfire is arguably the most famous - Considered by some to be the quintessential British fighter.

With a top speed of 125 m/s, and fantastic control responsiveness, this is a plane to be reckoned with.

This replica is 1:1 scale, and includes functioning flaps and realistic control layouts.

Take-Off Procedure:

I've found the best way to take off is to lower the flaps and set full throttle, but don't pull up until the plane tips onto the main wheels and the tailwheel is off the ground. Then pull up very gently, and retract the gear and flaps.

Download

 

Messerschmitt Bf 109

The Messerschmitt Bf 109 was a German fighter and was the most produced fighter plane in history. It was an incredibly competent aircraft, remaining a threat to Allied fighter's through the end of the war.

Parts: 131

Mass: 7.0 tons

Cost: 56399

Top Speed: 115 m/s

BDArmory version: Two wing mounted machine guns, 1x 500 lb bomb

Stock Version Download

BDArmory version Download

 

Mitsubishi A6M Zero

The Mitsubishi Zero was a Japanese long range fighter plane, that was widely known in the early war period as the most capable carrier-based fighter. This was primarily due to its long range and excellent maneuverability. Includes a fuel drop-pod and a tailhook for carrier landings.

Parts: 156

Mass: 9.2 tons

Cost: 81360

Top Speed: 125 m/s

BDArmory version: Two wing mounted machine guns, one nose mounted machine gun

Stock Version Download

BDArmory version Download

Trucks

Spoiler

Utility:

GAZ AAA

The GAZ AAA was a 6x4 cargo truck based on the Ford Model AA and built by GAZ in the Soviet Union.

Parts: 267

Mass: 14.7 tons

Cost: 57092

Download

 

GAZ AAA Quad Maxim

The GAZ AAA was a 6x4 cargo truck based on the Ford Model AA and built by GAZ in the Soviet Union. This replica has a lookalike Russian Quad Maxim gun mounted in the bed.

Parts: 283

Mass: 14.4 tons

Cost: 73302

Download

 

Willys MB

The Willys MB was a four-wheel drive light utility vehicle used by the US Army in the later years of WWII. It eventually evolved into the series of civilian offroad Jeeps we all know.

Parts: 196

Mass: 8.5 tons

Cost: 51045

Download

Tanks

Spoiler

 

Light:

Planned:

M3 Stuart

 

Medium:

M4 Sherman

The M4 Sherman was the most numerous battle tank used by the United States in WWII, being reliable and mobile. This replica is modeled after the cast hull variant, and has a functional turret that can be separated by staging, and runs impressively smoothly. Take care not to turn too fast as the turret makes the craft top heavy.

Parts: 331

Mass: 27.9 tons

Cost: 199107

BDArmory version: One 105 mm howitzer on the turret, one 30 mm automatic cannon on the body

Stock Version Download

BDArmory version Download

Ships

Spoiler

Landing Craft:

LCVP - Higgins Boat

LCVPs (Landing Craft, Vehicle and Personnel), were used to deliver troops by water, where they would be deployed from transport ships. The basic design and cheap materials made LCVPs straightforward and inexpensive to build. The ramp on this replica is fully functional and surprisingly robust - it uses @Majorjim's thermometer bearing. Use staging to detach the ramp, and when controlling the ramp use Action Group 1 to toggle the latch and pitch controls to raise or lower it.

Parts: 238

Mass: 18.1 tons

Cost: 64388

Download

 

Cruisers:

Cleveland Class Light Cruiser

The Cleveland-class cruisers were designed by the US Navy with a goal of increased range, along with upgrades in armaments and defense. This craft is functional and is crewed by seven kerbals. Control with yaw.

-I'll be rebuilding this to a higher scale now that buoyancy has been revamped. Also it currently floats with the deck underwater, just a warning.

Parts: 804

Mass: 150.7 tons

Cost: 416853

BDArmory version: 4 Flak turrets, 12 Howitzers on 6 turrets, 4 30mm cannons

 

 

 

 

Thank you for joining me, good building to you all!

Disclaimer:

Anyone is free to download, use, and change these crafts as they see fit. However, these crafts are my intellectual property and therefore you may not duplicate or claim as your own any of them. If you present these crafts in any form (pictures, videos), credit must be given with a link to this thread. Downloads for these crafts may only be posted with express written permission from the author (Morgan Gilbert, aka. Rix Killian). By downloading these crafts you agree to these terms.

I'd love to see any uses of these craft, so shoot me a message if you want to!

Note: Due to the 1.05 update, some craft were damaged to the point of unflyability, so I took those off the list. Temporarily! Once I fix them (some of them need a total rebuild) I'll repost them. The old versions can still be found on my Kerbalx page.

Edited May 5, 2016 by RixKillian
Updated Supermarine Spitfire
